page.title: 02YEADON
page.content: Yeadon High Street is a narrow twisting one way road.At the bottom is "The Steep" which has{cobbles.}There are lots of different shops and banks and a Chinese Take Away shop.The buildings are very old.The{oldest}is "The Great Outdoors"which was built in 1782.On Mondays and Fridays there is a {market}in the cobbled square in front of the{Town Hall}which was built in 1880. It is made of stone and has a main tower with 3 clock faces.It has an arched doorway with 8 steps going up to it.It has lots of big windows and gargoyles .The Town Hall is used for Jumble Sales, Bring and Buy, Coffee Mornings, Old Peoples' Meetings and Shows. I went to see "Jack and the Beanstalk "There is a balcony but I sat on the bottom row in seat number 30...{ PATRICK SMITH, {RICHARD VAN HEESWYCK,KIRSTY & ADELE.
